text: Yoshio Taniguchi (谷口 吉生, Taniguchi Yoshio; 17 October 1937 – 16 December 2024) was a Japanese architect. He was best known for his redesign of the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. He was born in Tokyo, Japan. He also designed the Tokyo Sea Life Park and Kagawa Prefectural Higashiyama Kaii Setouchi Art Museum. Taniguchi died from pneumonia on 16 December 2024 in Tokyo at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Museum of Modern Art biography Category:1937 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Japanese architects Category:Artists from Tokyo Category:Deaths from pneumonia
